subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal may make a prohibition order against a person subject to any conditions that it thinks fit, including the condition that the prohibition order is to have no effect if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: satisfies the judgment, order or claim concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides the security that the Tribunal orders.

subsection.leadIn: A person on whose application a prohibition order is made must serve a copy of the prohibition order and a copy of any other order ancillary to the prohibition order on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director of Immigration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner of Police; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person against whom the prohibition order is made, if the person can be found.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Tribunal (審裁處) includes the Registrar of the Tribunal.

section.name: s151B
section.heading: Duration and discharge of prohibition order

subsection.content: A prohibition order is valid for 1 month beginning on the date of the prohibition order unless extended or renewed under this section.

The Tribunal may, on application by a person on whose application a prohibition order is made, extend the prohibition order for a period that, in combination with the initial period and any other period of extension, does not exceed 3 months.
The Tribunal may, on application by a person on whose application a prohibition order is made, renew the prohibition order.
A renewed prohibition order is valid for 1 month beginning on the date of renewal and may be extended under subsection (2).
A reference to the initial period in subsection (2) is a reference to the period of 1 month mentioned in subsection (1) or (4).

subsection.leadIn: A person on whose application a prohibition order is made must, as soon as reasonably possible after the prohibition order is no longer required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve on the Director of Immigration a notice stating that fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: file with the Registrar of the Tribunal a copy of the notice mentioned in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: If the notice under subsection (6) is served and the copy of the notice under that subsection is filed on the same date, the prohibition order ceases to have effect on that date, but if the notice is served and the copy of the notice is filed on different dates, the prohibition order ceases to have effect on the later of those dates.
The Tribunal may, on application, discharge a prohibition order, either absolutely or subject to any conditions that it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prohibition order (禁止令) means an order made under section 151A;
Tribunal (審裁處) includes the Registrar of the Tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal makes a prohibition order against a person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person, having been served with a copy of the prohibition order or otherwise informed of its existence and effect, attempts to leave Hong Kong in contravention of the prohibition order,

subsection.continued: the person may be arrested by an immigration officer, a police officer or a bailiff of the Tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: A person arrested under subsection (1) must be brought before the Tribunal before the expiry of the day after the day of arrest, and the Tribunal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make an order discharging the person from arrest, either absolutely or subject to any conditions that it thinks fit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the prohibition order is made under section 151A(1)(a)(i), make an order for the examination or imprisonment of the person, under the rules of the Tribunal made under section 158, that the Tribunal considers appropriate; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the prohibition order is made under section 151A(1)(a)(ii) or (iii) or (b), make an order for the imprisonment of the person until the prohibition order ceases to have effect or is discharged.

subsection.content: Section 71 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) does not apply to subsection (2).
The Director of Immigration is not liable for any failure to prevent a person against whom a prohibition order is made from leaving Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prohibition order (禁止令) means an order made under section 151A;
Tribunal (審裁處) includes the Registrar of the Tribunal.

subsection.content: A decision of the Tribunal must be recorded in writing.
Where it is appropriate to give reasons for a decision, the decision may be made initially without giving reasons but, if this is done, the reasons must be recorded in writing.

section.name: s153
section.heading: Orders of Tribunal
section.content: An order made by the Tribunal must be recorded in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings (whenever instituted) before the Tribunal for the recovery of a debt or damages, the Tribunal may include in a sum for which judgment is given simple interest on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all or a part of the sum for which judgment is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all or a part of a sum in respect of which payment is made before judgment.

subsection.leadIn: Interest under subsection (1) may be awarded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the sum for which judgment is given, for all or a part of the period beginning on the date when the cause of action arose and ending on the date of the judgment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a sum in respect of which payment is made before judgment, for all or a part of the period beginning on the date when the cause of action arose and ending on the date of the payment.

subsection.def: In proceedings (whenever instituted) before the Tribunal for the recovery of a debt, if the person from whom the debt is sought (defendant) pays the whole debt to the person seeking the debt (plaintiff) otherwise than in compliance with a judgment in the proceedings, the defendant is liable to pay the plaintiff simple interest on all or a part of the debt for all or a part of the period beginning on the date when the cause of action arose and ending on the date of the payment.

subsection.content: Interest under this section is to be calculated at a rate that the Tribunal thinks fit.
Interest in respect of a debt may not be awarded under this section for a period during which, for whatever reason, interest on the debt already runs.
Interest under this section may be calculated at different rates for different periods.
Subsections (1), (2) and (3) are subject to the rules of the Tribunal made under section 158.

subsection.leadIn: A judgment debt is to carry simple interest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the rate that the Tribunal specifies by order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of such an order, at the rate that the Chief Justice from time to time determines by order,

subsection.continued: on the total amount of the judgment debt, or on the part of the judgment debt that for the time being remains unpaid, from the date of the judgment until payment.

subsection.content: Interest under this section may be calculated at different rates for different periods.

Subject to subsection (2) and section 155, an appeal lies as of right to the Court of Appeal against any decision (including a decision as to the amount of any compensatory sanction or pecuniary penalty), determination or order of the Tribunal made under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An appeal does not lie—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: against an order of the Tribunal allowing an extension of time for appealing against a decision, determination or order of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: against a decision, determination or order of the Tribunal if it is provided by any Ordinance or by the rules of the Tribunal made under section 158 that the decision, determination or order is final; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without the leave of the Court of Appeal or the Tribunal, against an order of the Tribunal made with the consent of the parties or relating only to costs that are left to the discretion of the Tribunal.

subsection.content: Rules of the Tribunal made under section 158 may provide for decisions, determinations or orders of any prescribed description to be treated for any prescribed purpose connected with appeals to the Court of Appeal as final or interlocutory.

An appeal does not lie against a decision of the Court of Appeal as to whether a decision, determination or order of the Tribunal is, for any purpose connected with an appeal to the Court, final or interlocutory.

subsection.leadIn: The Court of Appeal has jurisdiction to hear and determine an appeal under subsection (1) and may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm, set aside or vary the decision, determination or order of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the decision, determination or order of the Tribunal is set aside, substitute any other decision, determination or order it considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remit the matter in question to the Tribunal for reconsideration in the light of the decision of the Court.

subsection.content: Except in the case of an appeal against the imposition, or the amount, of a pecuniary penalty, the making of an appeal under this section does not suspend the effect of the decision, determination or order to which the appeal relates.

section.name: s155
section.heading: Leave to appeal required for interlocutory appeals

subsection.content: Except as provided by the rules of the Tribunal made under section 158, an appeal does not lie to the Court of Appeal against any interlocutory decision, determination or order of the Tribunal unless leave to appeal has been granted by the Court of Appeal or the Tribunal.

Rules of the Tribunal made under section 158 may specify an interlocutory decision, determination or order of any prescribed description as being an interlocutory decision, determination or order to which subsection (1) does not apply and accordingly an appeal lies as of right against the decision, determination or order.

subsection.leadIn: Leave to appeal for the purpose of subsection (1) may be granted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of a particular issue arising out of the interlocutory decision, determination or order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to any conditions that the Court of Appeal or the Tribunal considers necessary in order to secure the just, expeditious and economical disposal of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: Leave to appeal may only be granted under subsection (1) if the Court of Appeal or the Tribunal is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appeal has a reasonable prospect of success; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is some other reason in the interests of justice why the appeal should be heard.

section.name: s155A
section.heading: Enforcement by Tribunal of payment of penalties and fines

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal may enforce payment of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pecuniary penalty imposed under section 93;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a financial penalty imposed under section 169; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a fine imposed by the Tribunal,

subsection.continued: in the same manner in which a judgment of the Court of First Instance for the payment of money may be enforced.

subsection.leadIn: If a penalty or fine described in subsection (1) is not paid in full when it is due—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal may certify in writing to the Registrar of the Tribunal the sum payable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is to enforce payment of the sum certified as a judgment debt due to the Registrar.

section.name: s156
section.heading: Registrar and other staff of Tribunal
section.content: Every Registrar, temporary registrar, senior deputy registrar, temporary senior deputy registrar, deputy registrar, temporary deputy registrar and any other officer such as a Bailiff of the High Court, by virtue of that appointment, holds the corresponding office or position in the Tribunal.

section.name: s156A
section.heading: Jurisdiction and powers of Registrar of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has the same jurisdiction and privileges, in so far as they are applicable to the business and proceedings of the Tribunal, as the Registrar of the High Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may exercise the same powers and perform the same duties, in so far as they are applicable to the business and proceedings of the Tribunal, as the Registrar of the High Court.

subsection.content: The Registrar of the Tribunal has any other jurisdiction, privileges, powers and duties that may be conferred or imposed on him or her by or under the rules of the Tribunal made under section 158 or any other law.

section.name: s156B
section.heading: Jurisdiction and powers of deputy registrars of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: A senior deputy registrar of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has the same jurisdiction and privileges, in so far as they are applicable to the business and proceedings of the Tribunal, as a senior deputy registrar of the High Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may exercise the same powers and perform the same duties, in so far as they are applicable to the business and proceedings of the Tribunal, as a senior deputy registrar of the High Court.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the rules of the Tribunal made under section 158, a senior deputy registrar of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has all the jurisdiction and privileges conferred on the Registrar of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may exercise all the powers conferred, and perform all the duties imposed, on the Registrar of the Tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: A deputy registrar of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has the same jurisdiction and privileges, in so far as they are applicable to the business and proceedings of the Tribunal, as a deputy registrar of the High Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may exercise the same powers and perform the same duties, in so far as they are applicable to the business and proceedings of the Tribunal, as a deputy registrar of the High Court.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the rules of the Tribunal made under section 158, a deputy registrar of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has all the jurisdiction and privileges conferred on the Registrar of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may exercise all the powers conferred, and perform all the duties imposed, on the Registrar of the Tribunal.

section.name: s156C
section.heading: Jurisdiction and powers of temporary registrars of Tribunal

subsection.content: A temporary registrar of the Tribunal has, during the period for which he or she is appointed, all the jurisdiction, privileges, powers and duties of the Registrar of the Tribunal and a reference in any law to the Registrar of the Tribunal is to be construed accordingly.

A temporary senior deputy registrar of the Tribunal has, during the period for which he or she is appointed, all the jurisdiction, privileges, powers and duties of a senior deputy registrar of the Tribunal and a reference in any law to a senior deputy registrar of the Tribunal is to be construed accordingly.

A temporary deputy registrar of the Tribunal has, during the period for which he or she is appointed, all the jurisdiction, privileges, powers and duties of a deputy registrar of the Tribunal and a reference in any law to a deputy registrar of the Tribunal is to be construed accordingly.

If a temporary registrar of the Tribunal adjourns the hearing of any proceedings or reserves judgment in any proceedings, the temporary registrar has power to resume the hearing and determine the proceedings or deliver judgment, even though before the hearing is resumed or judgment is delivered, his or her appointment as a temporary registrar has expired or has been terminated.
Subsection (4) applies to a temporary senior deputy registrar and a temporary deputy registrar of the Tribunal as it applies to a temporary registrar of the Tribunal.
A person may not bring an action against the Registrar of the Tribunal for an act done or omitted to be done by a bailiff of the Tribunal without directions from the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: A person may not bring an action against the Registrar of the Tribunal for a direction given to a bailiff of the Tribunal with regard to the execution or non-execution of process if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the direction is given in accordance with an order made by the Tribunal under section 156E; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar has not wilfully misrepresented or suppressed any material fact.

section.name: s156E
section.heading: Registrar of Tribunal may apply to Tribunal for order

subsection.content: In relation to a matter regarding the execution or non-execution of process, the Registrar of the Tribunal may, in case of doubt or difficulty, apply summarily to the Tribunal for an order for the direction and guidance of a bailiff of the Tribunal.
The Tribunal may make any order in the matter that it considers just and reasonable.
The Tribunal is to have a seal approved by the Chief Justice.
All writs, judgments, orders and other documents, and any exemplification or copies of writs, judgments, orders and other documents, are to be sealed with the seal.

All writs, judgments, orders and other documents, and any exemplification or copies of writs, judgments, orders and other documents, when purporting to be so sealed, are admissible in evidence before any court on production without further proof.

section.name: s157A
section.heading: Reimbursement of witness expenses
section.content: In any proceedings before the Tribunal, a member of the Tribunal may order the reimbursement of a witness for any expenses reasonably and properly incurred by the witness by reason of his or her attendance at the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Judge may, after consulting the President, make rules regulating and prescribing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the practice and procedure to be followed in the Tribunal in all matters with respect to which the Tribunal has jurisdiction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any matters incidental to or relating to that practice or procedure.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), rules may be made for the following purposes—

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: prescribing the jurisdiction of the Tribunal that the Registrar, a senior deputy registrar or a deputy registrar of the Tribunal may exercise (including provision for appeal against decisions made in the exercise of the jurisdiction); (Added 15 of 2014 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing fees and regulating matters relating to the fees payable in connection with applications to the Tribunal and proceedings in the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing the manner and form in which documents are to be issued or served in relation to proceedings in the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribing the manner in which and the terms on which proceedings are conducted with the assistance of an assessor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribing the manner and form in which documents may be filed in the Tribunal and the manner in which evidence may be given in proceedings; (Amended 15 of 2014 s. 10)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prescribing the allowances to be paid to witnesses appearing before the Tribunal; and (Amended 15 of 2014 s. 10)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: prescribing the form of any order that the Tribunal may make under this Ordinance. (Added 15 of 2014 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Judge may, after consulting the President, make rules for regulating the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the deposit, payment, delivery, and transfer in, into, and out of the Tribunal of money, securities and movable property of suitors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the evidence of such deposit, payment, delivery, or transfer, and the investment of and other dealings with money, securities and movable property in the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the execution of the orders of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the powers and duties of the Registrar of the Tribunal with reference to such money, securities and movable property.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), rules made under that subsection may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulating the placing on and withdrawal from deposit of money in the Tribunal, and the payment or crediting of interest on money placed on deposit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determining the smallest amount of money on deposit on which interest is to be credited to an account to which money placed on deposit belongs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: determining the time at which money placed on deposit is to begin and to cease to bear interest and the mode of computing such interest;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: determining the cases in which money placed on deposit is to begin and to cease to bear interest and the mode of computing such interest;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: determining the cases in which interest on money placed on deposit is, and the dividends on any securities standing in the name of the Registrar of the Tribunal are, to be placed on deposit; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: disposing of money remaining unclaimed in the Tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: securities (證券) includes shares.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Concurrent Jurisdiction Relating to Telecommunications and Broadcasting

subsection.leadIn: The Communications Authority may perform the functions of the Commission under this Ordinance, in so far as they relate to the conduct of undertakings that are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: licensees under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: persons who, although not such licensees, are persons whose activities require them to be licensed under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: persons who have been exempted from the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or from specified provisions of that Ordinance under section 39 of that Ordinance.

subsection.content: So far as is necessary for the purpose of subsection (1), references in this Ordinance to the Commission are to be read as including the Communications Authority.

section.name: s160
section.heading: Transfer of competition matter between competition authorities

subsection.content: Where one competition authority is performing a function in relation to a competition matter and another competition authority also has jurisdiction to perform functions in relation to that matter, the 2 competition authorities may agree that the matter be transferred to and be dealt with by one of them.

Where more than one competition authority has jurisdiction to perform functions in relation to a competition matter, if one of them is performing or has performed a function in relation to that matter, then, unless there is an agreement of a kind mentioned in subsection (1), the other competition authority must not perform any function in relation to that matter.

As soon as is reasonably practicable after the coming into operation of this section, the Commission and the Communications Authority must prepare and sign a Memorandum of Understanding, for the purpose of co-ordinating the performance of their functions under this Ordinance.
Without limiting subsection (1), the Memorandum of Understanding must provide for any or all of the matters set out in Schedule 6.
The Commission and the Communications Authority may amend or replace any Memorandum of Understanding prepared and signed under this section.
Before signing any Memorandum of Understanding, or any amendment to it, under this section, the Commission and the Communications Authority must consult the Legislative Council.

The Commission and the Communications Authority must, within 6 weeks after the Memorandum of Understanding, or any amendment to it, is signed by them, publish it in any manner they consider appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission and the Communications Authority must make available copies of any Memorandum of Understanding prepared and signed under this section and of all amendments made to it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at their offices during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other manner they consider appropriate.

subsection.content: A Memorandum of Understanding prepared and signed under this section and all amendments made to it are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s162
section.heading: Merger
section.content: Schedule 7 (Mergers) has effect.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, the turnover of an undertaking is to be determined in accordance with the regulations made by the Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development under subsection (2).
The Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development may, by regulations published in the Gazette, provide for the determination of the turnover of an undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2), the regulations made under that subsection may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify a period as the turnover period of an undertaking for the purpose of section 5(4) or 6(3) of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for different ways for the determination of the turnover of an undertaking obtained in Hong Kong or outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: provide for different ways for the determination of the turnover of an undertaking in respect of different periods, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a calendar year;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a financial year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a period specified as the turnover period of the undertaking under paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may charge a fee for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the making of an application to the Commission under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provision of any service.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may make regulations prescribing the amount of the fees chargeable under this section.

The amount of any fee that may be prescribed in a regulation made under subsection (2) is not limited by reference to the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in relation to the application or service to which the fee relates.

subsection.leadIn: A regulation made under this section may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of any fee to be charged by reference to a scale set out in the regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the payment of different fees by different persons or different classes or descriptions of person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fees that are to be paid annually or at other intervals; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the reduction, waiver or refund, in whole or in part, of any fee, either upon the happening of a certain event or in the discretion of the Commission.

subsection.content: The Commission may recover any fee payable under this section as a civil debt due to the Commission.

A public officer is not personally liable for anything done or omitted to be done by the public officer in good faith in the performance of a function or purported performance of a function under this Ordinance.
The protection conferred by subsection (1) does not affect any liability of the Government for the act or omission.

subsection.leadIn: A notice or other document required to be served on the Commission under this Ordinance may be served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by sending it by post to the offices of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by leaving it at the offices of the Commission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending it by facsimile transmission to the facsimile number of the Commission;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the Commission; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by sending it by any other method specified in rules made by the Commission for this purpose under section 34 of Schedule 5.

subsection.leadIn: A notice or other document served in accordance with subsection (1) is to be taken, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to have been served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if served by post, on the second day after the day on which it was posted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if left at the offices of the Commission, on the day after the day on which it was so left;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if sent by facsimile transmission, on the day after the day on which it was transmitted; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if sent by electronic mail transmission, on the day after the day on which it was transmitted.

section.name: s167
section.heading: Service of documents other than on Commission

subsection.leadIn: A notice, direction or other document required to be served by the Commission for the purposes of this Ordinance may be served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of service on a natural person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to the person personally;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by post in a letter addressed to the person at the person’s usual place of residence or business or, if the person’s address is unknown, addressed to the person’s last known place of residence or business;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by facsimile transmission to the facsimile number of the person or, if that number is unknown, to the last known facsimile number of the person; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the person or, if that address is unknown, to the last known electronic mail address of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of service on a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to any place in Hong Kong at which the body corporate carries on business and giving it to any person in the place who appears to be concerned in the management of, or employed by, the body corporate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by post in a letter addressed to the body corporate at its registered office in Hong Kong or at any place in Hong Kong at which the body corporate carries on business or, if the body corporate’s address is unknown, addressed to the body corporate’s last known place of business;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by facsimile transmission to the facsimile number of the body corporate or, if that number is unknown, to the last known facsimile number of the body corporate; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the body corporate or, if that address is unknown, to the last known electronic mail address of the body corporate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of service on a partnership—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to any place in Hong Kong at which the partnership carries on business and giving it to any person in the place who appears to be concerned in the management of, or employed by, the partnership;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by post in a letter addressed to the partnership at any place in Hong Kong at which the partnership carries on business or, if the partnership’s address is unknown, addressed to the partnership’s last known place of business;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by facsimile transmission to the facsimile number of the partnership or, if that number is unknown, to the last known facsimile number of the partnership; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the partnership or, if that address is unknown, to the last known electronic mail address of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of service on an undertaking other than a natural person, a body corporate or a partnership—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it personally to an officer of the undertaking or a member of its governing body;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by post in a letter addressed to the undertaking at any place in Hong Kong at which the undertaking carries on business or, if the undertaking’s address is unknown, addressed to the undertaking’s last known place of business;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by facsimile transmission to the facsimile number of the undertaking or, if that number is unknown, to the last known facsimile number of the undertaking; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the undertaking or, if that address is unknown, to the last known electronic mail address of the undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: A notice, direction or other document served in accordance with subsection (1) is to be taken to have been served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if served by post, on the second day after the day on which it was posted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if sent by facsimile transaction, on the day after the day on which it was transmitted; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if sent by electronic mail transmission, on the day after the day on which it was transmitted.

section.name: s168
section.heading: Certain indemnities of officers, employees or agents void

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 170, no person may indemnify another person who is or was an officer, employee or agent of an undertaking against liability for paying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pecuniary penalty under Part 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: costs incurred in defending an action in which that other person is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: convicted of contempt of the Tribunal;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: convicted of an offence under this Part or Part 3; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: ordered to pay a pecuniary penalty under Part 6.

subsection.content: An indemnity given in contravention of subsection (1) is void.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: employee (僱員), in relation to an undertaking, means a person engaged by the undertaking for the provision of services, whether under a contract of employment or otherwise;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an undertaking being a corporation, a director, manager or company secretary of the undertaking, and any other person involved in the management of the undertaking; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an undertaking not being a corporation, any member of the governing body of that undertaking.

section.name: s169
section.heading: Financial penalty for contravention of section 168

subsection.content: If it appears to the Commission that a person has indemnified any other person in contravention of section 168, the Commission may apply to the Tribunal for an order imposing a financial penalty on that person.
If the Tribunal is satisfied that a person has contravened section 168, it may make an order imposing a financial penalty on that person.
The amount of a financial penalty imposed under this section may not exceed twice the value of the indemnity given in contravention of section 168.

section.name: s170
section.heading: Provision of funds for indemnity for defending proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Section 168 does not prohibit any person from providing funds to another person who is or was an officer, employee or agent of an undertaking to meet expenditure incurred or to be incurred by that other person in defending any proceedings under Part 6 for a pecuniary penalty, if it is done on the following terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the funds are to be repaid in the event of the other person being required by the Tribunal to pay the pecuniary penalty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that they are to be repaid not later than the date when the decision of the Tribunal becomes final.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of this section a decision of the Tribunal becomes final—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if not appealed against, at the end of the period for bringing an appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if appealed against, when the appeal or further appeal is finally disposed of.

subsection.leadIn: An appeal is finally disposed of, for the purpose of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is determined and the period for bringing any further appeal has ended; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is abandoned or otherwise ceases to have effect.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: officer (高級人員) has the meaning given by section 168(3).

section.name: s171
section.heading: Criminal proceedings not to be brought in Tribunal

subsection.content: Criminal proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance may not be brought in the Tribunal.
To avoid doubt, subsection (1) does not affect the jurisdiction, powers and duties of the Tribunal in respect of the punishment of a person guilty of contempt, granted by section 144(2).

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in any representation made to the Commission under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provides any information that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows or is reckless as to whether the information is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under this section is liable to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s173
section.heading: Employees not to suffer termination etc. for assisting Commission

subsection.leadIn: A person who employs another person under a contract of employment (an employee) must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: terminate or threaten to terminate the employment of that employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: discriminate in any way against that employee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: intimidate or harass that employee; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: cause that employee any injury, loss or damage,

subsection.continued: because the employee has taken any action referred to in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The actions referred to in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing any material to the Commission in connection with the Commission’s functions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: giving evidence or agreeing to give evidence in any proceedings brought by the Commission for the enforcement of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, obstructs a specified person in the performance of any function under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) has the meaning given by section 122.

section.name: s175
section.heading: Offences by bodies corporate and partners

subsection.leadIn: If a person by whom an offence under this Ordinance is committed is a body corporate, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of a director, manager, company secretary or other person concerned in the management of the body corporate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of a director, manager, company secretary or other person concerned in the management of the body corporate,

subsection.continued: the director, manager, company secretary or other person also commits the offence.

subsection.leadIn: If a person by whom an offence under this Ordinance is committed is a partner in a partnership, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of any other partner or any person concerned in the management of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of any other partner or any person concerned in the management of the partnership,

subsection.continued: the partner or the person concerned in the management of the partnership also commits the offence.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Consequential, Related, Transitional and Savings Provisions

section.name: s177
section.heading: Transitional and savings provisions in relation to amendments made by this Ordinance

subsection.content: Schedule 9 contains transitional and savings provisions in relation to amendments made by this Ordinance to the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391) and the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562).

The Chief Executive may make regulations containing transitional provisions and savings that are necessary or convenient for the transition to the provisions of this Ordinance from the provisions of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) as amended by this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2), regulations made under this section may, in particular, provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application of provisions of this Ordinance to telecommunications services or broadcasting services; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the continued application of provisions of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) in force immediately before the commencement of any provision of this Ordinance to telecommunications services or broadcasting services.

subsection.content: Regulations made under this section may, if they so provide, be deemed to have come into operation on a date earlier than the date on which they are published in the Gazette but not earlier than the date on which this Ordinance is published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: To the extent that any regulations made under this section come into operation on a date earlier than the date on which they are published in the Gazette, those regulations are to be construed so as not to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: impose liabilities on any person in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, before the date on which the regulations are published in the Gazette.

subsection.content: If there is any inconsistency between any regulations made under this section and the provisions of Schedule 9, Schedule 9 prevails to the extent of the inconsistency.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Agreements enhancing overall economic efficiency
section.leadIn: The first conduct rule does not apply to any agreement that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: contributes to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: improving production or distribution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: promoting technical or economic progress,

paragraph.continued: while allowing consumers a fair share of the resulting benefit;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: does not afford the undertakings concerned the possibility of eliminating competition in respect of a substantial part of the goods or services in question.

subsection.content: The first conduct rule does not apply to an agreement to the extent that it is made for the purpose of complying with a legal requirement.
The second conduct rule does not apply to conduct to the extent that it is engaged in for the purpose of complying with a legal requirement.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: LegalRequirement
def.leadIn: legal requirement (法律規定) means a requirement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: imposed by or under any enactment in force in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: imposed by any national law applying in Hong Kong.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Services of general economic interest etc.
section.content: Neither the first conduct rule nor the second conduct rule applies to an undertaking entrusted by the Government with the operation of services of general economic interest in so far as the conduct rule would obstruct the performance, in law or in fact, of the particular tasks assigned to it.

subsection.content: To the extent to which an agreement (either on its own or when taken together with another agreement) results in, or if carried out would result in, a merger, the first conduct rule does not apply to the agreement.

To the extent to which conduct (either on its own or when taken together with other conduct) results in, or if engaged in would result in, a merger, the second conduct rule does not apply to the conduct.

subsection.leadIn: The first conduct rule does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a concerted practice engaged in by undertakings in any calendar year if the combined turnover of the undertakings for the turnover period does not exceed $200,000,000; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a decision of an association of undertakings in any calendar year if the turnover of the association for the turnover period does not exceed $200,000,000.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to an agreement, a concerted practice, or a decision of an association of undertakings, that involves serious anti-competitive conduct.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), the turnover period of an undertaking is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the undertaking has a financial year, the financial year of the undertaking that ends in the preceding calendar year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the undertaking does not have a financial year, the preceding calendar year.

subsection.leadIn: The turnover period of an undertaking is the period specified as such for the purpose of this subsection in the regulations made under section 163(2) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for an undertaking that has a financial year—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the undertaking does not have a financial year that ends in the preceding calendar year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the financial year of the undertaking that ends in the preceding calendar year is less than 12 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for an undertaking that does not have a financial year—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the undertaking is not engaged in economic activity in the preceding calendar year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the period in which the undertaking is engaged in economic activity in the preceding calendar year is less than 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: preceding calendar year (對上公曆年) means the calendar year preceding the calendar year mentioned in subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an undertaking that is not an association of undertakings, means the total gross revenues of the undertaking whether obtained in Hong Kong or outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an association of undertakings, means the total gross revenues of all the members of the association whether obtained in Hong Kong or outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The second conduct rule does not apply to conduct engaged in by an undertaking the turnover of which does not exceed $40,000,000 for the turnover period.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the turnover period of an undertaking is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the undertaking has a financial year, the financial year of the undertaking that ends in the preceding calendar year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the undertaking does not have a financial year, the preceding calendar year.

subsection.leadIn: The turnover period of an undertaking is the period specified as such for the purpose of this subsection in the regulations made under section 163(2) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for an undertaking that has a financial year—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the undertaking does not have a financial year that ends in the preceding calendar year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the financial year of the undertaking that ends in the preceding calendar year is less than 12 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for an undertaking that does not have a financial year—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the undertaking is not engaged in economic activity in the preceding calendar year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the period in which the undertaking is engaged in economic activity in the preceding calendar year is less than 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: preceding calendar year (對上公曆年) means the calendar year preceding the calendar year in which the conduct mentioned in subsection (1) is engaged in;
turnover (營業額) means the total gross revenues of an undertaking whether obtained in Hong Kong or outside Hong Kong.

part.name: P1
part.heading:
Procedural Requirements for Acceptance and
Variation of Commitments

section.name: s1
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: Section 2 of this Schedule applies where the Commission proposes to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accept a commitment under section 60;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accept a variation of such a commitment under section 62; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accept a new commitment in substitution for such a commitment under section 62.

subsection.leadIn: Before accepting a commitment or variation, the Commission must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give notice of the proposed commitment or variation in any manner it considers appropriate for bringing it to the attention of those it considers likely to be affected by it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider any representations made (and not withdrawn) in response to the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Commission proposes to accept the commitment or variation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the intended object and effect of the commitment or variation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the commitment or variation constitutes an admission of contravention of a competition rule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the situation that the commitment or variation is seeking to deal with;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other facts that the Commission considers to be relevant to the acceptance or variation of the commitment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a means of gaining access, at all reasonable times, to an accurate version of the proposed commitment or variation; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the period within which representations may be made in relation to the proposed commitment or variation.

subsection.content: The period stated for the purpose of subsection (2)(g) must be at least 15 days beginning on the day on which the notice is given.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Notice of decision not to accept
section.content: If, after giving notice under section 2 of this Schedule, the Commission decides not to accept the commitment or variation concerned, the Commission must give notice that it has so decided.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Notice of acceptance
section.leadIn: As soon as practicable after accepting a commitment or a variation of a commitment, the Commission must publish the commitment or variation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Manner of giving notice
section.leadIn: A notice under section 2 or 3 of this Schedule must be given by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sending a copy of the notice to any person or persons the Commission considers are likely to be affected by the matter to which the notice relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: publishing the notice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate,

paragraph.continued: for the purpose of bringing the matter to which the notice relates to the attention of those the Commission considers likely to be affected by it.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Procedural Requirements for Withdrawal of Acceptance of Commitments

section.name: s6
section.heading: Application
section.content: Section 7 of this Schedule applies where the Commission proposes to withdraw its acceptance of a commitment under section 61.

subsection.leadIn: Before withdrawing its acceptance of a commitment, the Commission must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give notice of the proposed withdrawal in any manner it considers appropriate for bringing it to the attention of those it considers likely to be affected by it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider any representations made (and not withdrawn) in response to the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Commission proposes to withdraw its acceptance of the commitment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the proposed withdrawal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other facts that the Commission considers to be relevant to the proposed withdrawal; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the period within which representations may be made in relation to the proposed withdrawal.

subsection.content: The period stated for the purpose of subsection (2)(d) must be at least 15 days beginning on the day on which the notice is given.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Notice of decision not to withdraw
section.content: If, after giving notice under section 7 of this Schedule, the Commission decides not to withdraw its acceptance of the commitment concerned, the Commission must give notice that it has so decided.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Notice of withdrawal
section.leadIn: As soon as practicable after withdrawing its acceptance of a commitment, the Commission must publish the withdrawal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Manner of giving notice
section.leadIn: A notice under section 7 or 8 of this Schedule must be given by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sending a copy of the notice to any person or persons the Commission considers are likely to be affected by the matter to which the notice relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: publishing the notice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate,

paragraph.continued: for the purpose of bringing the matter to which the notice relates to the attention of those the Commission considers likely to be affected by it.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Procedural Requirements for Release of Commitments

section.name: s11
section.heading: Application
section.content: Section 12 of this Schedule applies where the Commission proposes to release a person from a commitment, under section 62.

subsection.leadIn: Before releasing the person from the commitment, the Commission must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: consider any representations made (and not withdrawn) in response to the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Commission proposes to release the person from the commitment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the proposed release;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other facts that the Commission considers to be relevant to the proposed release; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the period within which representations may be made in relation to the proposed release.

subsection.content: The period stated for the purpose of subsection (2)(d) must be at least 15 days beginning on the day on which the notice is given.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Notice of decision not to proceed
section.leadIn: If, after giving notice under section 12 of this Schedule, the Commission decides not to proceed with the release, it must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give notice that it has so decided; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send a copy of the notice to the person who made the commitment.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Notice of decision to release
section.leadIn: As soon as practicable after releasing a person from a commitment, the Commission must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: publish the release—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send a copy of the release to that person.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Manner of giving notice
section.leadIn: A notice under section 12 or 13 of this Schedule must be given by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sending a copy of the notice to any person or persons the Commission considers are likely to be affected by the matter to which the notice relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: publishing the notice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate,

paragraph.continued: for the purpose of bringing the matter to which the notice relates to the attention of those the Commission considers likely to be affected by it.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Orders that may be Made by Tribunal in relation to Contraventions of Competition Rules

section.name: s1
section.heading: Orders
section.leadIn: The Tribunal may make the following orders with respect to a contravention of the competition rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a declaration that a person has contravened a competition rule;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: an order requiring a person who has contravened a competition rule or been involved in the contravention to do any act or thing, including the taking of steps for the purpose of restoring the parties to any transaction to the position in which they were before the transaction was entered into;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an order restraining or prohibiting a person from acquiring, disposing of or otherwise dealing with any property specified in the order;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: an order appointing a person to administer the property of another person;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an order prohibiting a person from making or giving effect to an agreement;

paragraph.name: h
i
j
paragraph.leadIn: an order prohibiting the withholding from any person of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any goods or services; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any orders for any such goods or services;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: an order requiring a person to pay damages to any person who has suffered loss or damage as a result of the contravention;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.leadIn: an order prohibiting requiring as a condition of the supply of goods or services to any person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the buying of any goods or services;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the making of any payment in respect of goods or services other than the goods or services supplied; or

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: m
n
o
p
paragraph.content: an order requiring any person to pay to the Government or to any other specified person, as the Tribunal considers appropriate, an amount not exceeding the amount of any profit gained or loss avoided by that person as a result of the contravention; or

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: for the purpose of securing compliance with any other order made under this section, an order requiring any person who has contravened or been involved in the contravention to do or refrain from doing anything specified in the order.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Registration of orders relating to immovable property
section.leadIn: If any property specified in an order made under section 1(d) of this Schedule is immovable property, the order is, for the purpose of the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be regarded as an instrument affecting land; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: registrable, as an instrument affecting land, in the Land Registry under that Ordinance in any manner the Land Registrar considers appropriate.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In section 1(j) of this Schedule, a reference to withholding includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: agreeing or threatening to withhold; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: procuring others to withhold or to agree or threaten to withhold.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Provisions that may be Contained in Orders Made by Tribunal in relation to Anticipated Mergers and Mergers

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: An order may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the division of any business (whether by the sale of any part of its assets or otherwise); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the division of any undertaking or association of undertakings.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: An order made under section 1 of this Schedule may contain any provisions that the Tribunal considers appropriate to effect or take account of the division including, in particular, provision as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transfer or creation of property, rights, liabilities or obligations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of persons to whom the property, rights, liabilities or obligations are to be transferred or in whom they are to be vested;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the time within which the property, rights, liabilities or obligations are to be transferred or vested;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the adjustment of contracts (whether by discharge or reduction of any liability or obligation or otherwise);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the creation, allotment, surrender or cancellation of any shares, stock or securities;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the formation or winding up of any company or other body of persons corporate or unincorporate;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the amendment of the memorandum and articles or other instruments regulating any such company or other body of persons;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the extent to which, and the circumstances in which, provisions of the order affecting a company or other body of persons corporate or unincorporate in its share capital, constitution or other matters may be altered by the company or other body of persons concerned;

paragraph.name: i
j
paragraph.content: the continuation, with any necessary change of parties, of any legal proceedings;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the approval by any person of anything required by virtue of the order to be done or of any person to whom anything is to be transferred, or in whom anything is to be vested, by virtue of the order; or

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: the appointment of trustees or other persons to do anything on behalf of another person which is required of that person by virtue of the order or to monitor the doing by that person of any such thing.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: An order may prohibit or restrict—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the acquisition by any person of the whole or part of another person’s business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the doing of anything that will or may result in a merger.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: An order may provide that if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an acquisition of the kind mentioned in section 3(a) of this Schedule is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: anything is done that results in a merger,

section.continued: the persons concerned or any of them must observe any prohibitions or restrictions imposed by or under the order.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: Chairperson (主席) means the Chairperson of the Commission appointed under section 8 of this Schedule;
Chief Executive Officer (行政總裁) means the Chief Executive Officer of the Commission appointed under section 10 of this Schedule;
financial year (財政年度) means the financial year of the Commission as defined in section 20 of this Schedule;
statement of accounts (帳目報表) means the statement of the accounts of the Commission required to be prepared by section 23 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: The Commission is to consist of not less than 5 and not more than 16 members appointed by the Chief Executive.

In considering the appointment of a person as a member of the Commission, the Chief Executive may have regard to that person’s expertise or experience in industry, commerce, economics, law, small and medium enterprises or public policy.
Subject to this Schedule, a member holds office for the period, not exceeding 3 years, that is specified in the member’s letter of appointment, but is eligible for re-appointment.
The Chief Executive must publish a notice in the Gazette of all appointments made under this section.
A member is entitled to such terms (including remuneration and allowances) as the Chief Executive may determine.
The remuneration and allowances of a member are to be paid out of the funds of the Commission.
A member may, at any time, resign from office by giving written notice of resignation to the Chief Executive.
A notice of resignation is not effective unless it is signed by the member concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date on which the notice is received by the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may remove a member from office if the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to attend 3 consecutive meetings of the Commission without (in the opinion of the Chief Executive) sufficient cause;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: becomes bankrupt or is for the time being bound by a voluntary arrangement with his or her creditors;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is, under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136), found by the Court of First Instance (or any judge of the Court of First Instance) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his or her property and affairs;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: has been found by the Tribunal or another court to have contravened a competition rule;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is an officer of an undertaking that has been found by the Tribunal or another court to have contravened a competition rule;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: becomes a member of the Tribunal or a judge of another court;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: is appointed by the Tribunal as an assessor under section 141; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: is otherwise, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member.

subsection.content: If a member is removed from office under this section, the Chief Executive must give that member notice in writing informing the member of his or her removal from office.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a corporation, a director, manager or company secretary of the corporation, and any other person involved in the management of the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an undertaking (other than a corporation or partnership), any member of the governing body of that undertaking.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Vacancy in office of member
section.leadIn: The office of a member becomes vacant if the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: dies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: completes a term of office and is not reappointed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: resigns from office by written notice of resignation given to the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is removed from office by the Chief Executive under section 5 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: If the office of a member becomes vacant, the Chief Executive may appoint a suitable person to fill the vacancy.

A person appointed to fill a vacancy under this section holds office for the term that is specified in the member’s letter of appointment and that term may extend beyond the remainder of the term of the member whose office became vacant.
The Chief Executive is to appoint one of the members of the Commission (other than a member who is a public officer) to be the Chairperson of the Commission.
The Chairperson may, at any time, resign from that office by giving written notice of resignation to the Chief Executive.
A notice of resignation is not effective unless it is signed by the Chairperson.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date on which the notice is received by the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

subsection.content: The resignation of a person from the office of Chairperson does not affect that person’s term of office as a member.
If the Chairperson ceases to be a member, he or she also ceases to be the Chairperson.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Acting chairperson
section.content: If the Chairperson is temporarily unable to perform the functions of the office of Chairperson because of illness or absence from Hong Kong or for any other cause or if the office of Chairperson becomes vacant, the Chief Executive may appoint another member to act in place of the Chairperson and perform the functions of the office of Chairperson.

subsection.content: The Commission is, with the approval of the Chief Executive, to appoint a Chief Executive Officer of the Commission on such terms as, subject to subsection (3), the Commission may determine.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive Officer is responsible for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: managing the administrative affairs of the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: performing any other functions that may be assigned or delegated to the Chief Executive Officer by the Commission.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive Officer is to be paid out of the funds of the Commission such remuneration, benefits and expenses as the Commission, with the approval of the Chief Executive, may determine.
The Commission may employ such staff and engage on contract for services such other persons as it considers necessary to perform its functions.
The Commission may determine the remuneration and other conditions of employment of its staff and persons engaged on contracts for services.

The Commission may provide and maintain schemes (whether contributory or not) for the payment of retirement benefits, gratuities or other allowances to its employees or former employees and their dependants.

section.name: s12
section.heading: General procedure for meetings of Commission

subsection.content: Meetings of the Commission are to be held as often as necessary to enable the Commission to perform its functions.
A meeting of the Commission may be convened by the Chairperson.
The Chairperson must convene a meeting of the Commission on being given a notice for that purpose by 2 or more other members.

The procedure for convening meetings of the Commission and for the conduct of business at those meetings is, subject to this Schedule and to any rules made under section 34 of this Schedule, to be determined by the Commission.
The quorum for a meeting of the Commission is a majority of its members.

subsection.leadIn: A member who participates in the meeting by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means is to be regarded as being present at the meeting if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that member is able to hear the other members who are actually present at the meeting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the members who are actually present at the meeting are able to hear that member.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Presiding member at meetings of Commission
section.leadIn: A meeting of the Commission is to be presided over by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairperson; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of the Chairperson, the acting chairperson.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), each member who is present at a meeting of the Commission has one vote at the meeting.
The member presiding at a meeting of the Commission has a deliberative vote and also has a casting vote if the number of votes for and against a motion is equal.

Voting must not be carried out by secret ballot. The member presiding at a meeting of the Commission must ask each member to indicate how he or she has voted, and the result of the vote, showing which way each member has voted, must be recorded in the minutes.
A decision supported by a majority of the votes cast at the meeting of the Commission at which a quorum is present is the decision of the Commission.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Minutes
section.content: The Commission must cause minutes of the proceedings, including a record of all decisions made, at each meeting of the Commission to be recorded and preserved.

subsection.leadIn: A resolution is a valid resolution of the Commission, even if it is not passed at a meeting of the Commission, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proper notice of it is given to all members; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is signed, or assented to, by a majority of the members by letter, fax or other electronic transmission.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the date of a resolution referred to in this section is the date on which the last of the members constituting a majority of the members signs or assents to the resolution.

If any member requests, by notice in writing addressed to the Chairperson, that a resolution proposed to be made under subsection (1) be referred to a meeting of the Commission for consideration, the proposed resolution must be referred to a meeting of the Commission.
A request under subsection (3) must be made within 14 days after the day on which the notice referred to in subsection (1)(b) is given.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Decisions not invalidated by defects in appointment etc.
section.leadIn: Decisions of the Commission are not invalidated solely by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any defect in the appointment of a member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a vacancy amongst its members;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the absence of a member from the meeting at which the decision was taken; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any irregularity in the procedures adopted by the Commission that does not affect the decision taken.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Commission to submit estimates
section.content: The Commission must, not later than 31 December in each financial year, submit to the Chief Executive estimates of its income and expenditure for the next financial year.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Financial year
section.leadIn: The financial year of the Commission is— (Amended 18 of 2014 s. 174)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period beginning on the day on which this Schedule comes into operation and ending on the next 31 March; and (Amended 18 of 2014 s. 174)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period of 12 months ending on 31 March in each subsequent year.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Funds of Commission
section.leadIn: The funds of the Commission consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all money paid by the Government to the Commission and appropriated for that purpose by the Legislative Council; and (Amended 18 of 2014 s. 174)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all other money and property, including fees, interest and accumulations of income, received by the Commission.

subsection.content: The Commission is exempt from taxation under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).
To avoid doubt, subsection (1) does not apply to or in relation to any remuneration, benefits or expenses paid out of the funds of the Commission to a member of the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep accounts and other records that accurately record and explain its financial transactions and its financial position; and

paragraph.name: b
