paragraph.content: ensure that a statement of accounts is prepared as soon as practicable after the end of each financial year.

subsection.leadIn: The statement of accounts must give a true and fair view of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the state of affairs of the Commission as at the end of that financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the results of the operations and cash flows of the Commission in that financial year.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the commencement of this section, the Commission must appoint an auditor to audit its statement of accounts.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor must, as soon as practicable after the end of each financial year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: audit the accounts and statement of accounts required under section 23 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit a report on the statement of accounts to the Commission.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable, and in any case within 6 months after the end of each financial year, the Commission must prepare a report dealing with its activities in the preceding financial year.

subsection.leadIn: The report must contain the following information in relation to the financial year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an outline of the investigations carried out by the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summary of complaints received; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an outline of all proceedings brought before the Tribunal.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Annual report and audited accounts to be laid on table of Legislative Council
section.leadIn: As soon as practicable, and in any case within 6 months after the end of a financial year, the Commission must give a copy of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its annual report, prepared under section 25 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its statement of accounts; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report on the statement of accounts,

section.continued: to the Chief Executive who must arrange for them to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council.

subsection.content: The Director of Audit may, in respect of any financial year of the Commission, conduct an examination into the economy, efficiency and effectiveness with which the Commission has used its resources in performing its functions.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of conducting an examination under this section, the Director of Audit is entitled, at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have full and free access to all accounts, records and documents in the custody or under the control of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make a copy of the whole or any part of those accounts, records and documents; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to require any person who holds or is accountable for the accounts, records or documents to give any information or explanation that the Director of Audit considers necessary.

subsection.content: The Director of Audit may report to the President of the Legislative Council the results of an examination conducted under this section.
Subsection (1) does not operate to entitle the Director of Audit to question the merits of the policy objectives of the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may establish one or more committees—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to advise the Commission on such matters (within the scope of the Commission’s functions) as the Commission refers to it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to perform such functions of the Commission as the Commission delegates to it.

subsection.content: A committee may consist of such persons, whether members of the Commission or not, as the Commission determines.
The Commission may appoint a member of the Commission who is also a member of a committee to be the chairperson of that committee.
When the Commission establishes a committee under this section, it must specify, in writing, its terms of reference.
The Commission may, by notice in writing, amend the terms of reference of a committee.
A committee is subject to the control of the Commission and may be discharged or reconstituted at any time by the Commission.
Subject to any directions that may be given by the Commission, a committee may regulate its own procedure, including the determination of its quorum.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Commission, or a member of a committee established by the Commission, must disclose to the Commission any interest that the member has which is of a class or description determined by the Commission under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a member of the Commission, on the member’s first appointment to the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: at the beginning of each calendar year after the member’s appointment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on becoming aware of the existence of an interest not previously disclosed under this subsection; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: after the occurrence of any change to an interest previously disclosed under this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, for the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the class or description of the interest required to be disclosed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the details of the interest required to be disclosed and the manner in which such interest is to be disclosed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: from time to time change any matter determined under paragraph (a) or (b).

subsection.content: The Commission is to establish and maintain a register relating to any disclosure required to be made under subsection (1) (the register).

If a person makes a disclosure as required by subsection (1), the Commission must cause the person’s name and the particulars of the disclosure to be recorded in the register, and if a further disclosure is made, the Commission must cause the particulars of the further disclosure to be recorded in the register.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission must make the register available for inspection by any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the offices of the Commission during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Commission has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pecuniary interest, whether direct or indirect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a personal interest greater than that which the member has as a member of the general public,

subsection.continued: in any matter under discussion at a meeting of the Commission, the member must disclose the nature of the interest at the meeting.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions apply for the purposes of a disclosure under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure must be recorded in the minutes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the disclosure is made by the member presiding, the member must vacate the chair during the discussion;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the member (including one who has vacated the chair under paragraph (b)) must, if so required by the majority of the other members present, withdraw from the meeting during the discussion and must not in any case, except as otherwise determined by the majority of the other members present, vote on any resolution concerning the matter under the discussion or be counted for the purpose of establishing the existence of a quorum.

subsection.leadIn: When a matter is being dealt with by way of the circulation of written resolutions under section 17 of this Schedule, and a member of the Commission has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pecuniary interest in the matter, whether direct or indirect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a personal interest in the matter greater than that which the member has as a member of the general public,

subsection.continued: the member must disclose the nature of the interest by attaching to the resolutions being circulated a note recording the disclosure.

subsection.content: If a member has made a disclosure under subsection (3), the member’s signature (if any) is not to be counted for the purpose of section 17(1) of this Schedule unless the Chairperson directs otherwise.
If the member making a disclosure in respect of a matter under subsection (3) is the Chairperson, section 17 of this Schedule ceases to apply to the matter.
The validity of any proceeding of the Commission is not affected by the failure by a member of the Commission to comply with this section.
Subsections (1), (2) and (6) apply to a member of a committee established by the Commission, as if any reference to the Commission in subsections (1) and (6) were a reference to the committee.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Commission may delegate any of the functions of the Commission to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who is a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a committee established by the Commission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an employee of the Commission by name; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the holder of any office in the Commission, designated by the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the Commission may not delegate any of the following functions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the power to issue a block exemption order under section 15;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the power to vary or revoke a block exemption order under section 20;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the power to issue an infringement notice under section 67;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the duty to give a copy of its annual report, its statement of accounts, and the auditor’s report on the statement of accounts, to the Chief Executive under section 26 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the power to establish any committee under section 28 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the power to refer any matter to a committee;

paragraph.name: i
j
paragraph.content: the power to amend the terms of reference of a committee under section 28 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the power to discharge or reconstitute a committee under section 28 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: l
m
n
paragraph.content: the duty to prepare and issue guidelines under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: o
p
paragraph.content: the power to appeal to the courts;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: the power to borrow money under section 131 with the approval of the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: the power to invest funds of the Commission, in a manner approved by the Financial Secretary, under section 131; or

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: the power to authorize a person to authenticate the application of the seal of the Commission under section 35 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: A person purporting to act under an authorization granted under subsection (1) is to be regarded, unless the contrary is proved, to have been lawfully authorized under this section.

When the Commission delegates a function under section 31 of this Schedule, it may, subject to any condition it considers appropriate, authorize the delegate to subdelegate the performance of that function, in whole or in part, to any person.
A person purporting to act under an authorization granted under subsection (1) is to be regarded, unless the contrary is proved, to have been lawfully authorized under this section.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Delegation of power to obtain documents and information
section.content: Despite section 31 (Delegation by Commission) of this Schedule and section 32 (Subdelegation) of this Schedule, the Commission may delegate its power under section 41 (Powers to obtain documents and information) only to a member of the Commission, and that member may not subdelegate that power.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Rules
section.leadIn: The Commission may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulating the procedure to be followed at meetings of the Commission and at meetings of its committees;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regulating the administration of the Commission; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: regarding conflict of interest.

subsection.content: The Commission must provide itself with a seal.
The application of the seal must be authenticated by the Chairperson, or by some other member of the Commission authorized by the Commission for this purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Judicial notice is to be taken of the seal of the Commission and any document sealed with the seal is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: admissible in evidence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: presumed to have been properly sealed unless the contrary is proved.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Matters that must be Provided for in Memorandum of Understanding

section.name: s1
section.content: The manner in which the parties to a Memorandum of Understanding will perform the functions that they have jurisdiction to perform concurrently under this Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.content: The manner in which the parties will resolve any dispute between themselves.

section.name: s3
section.content: The provision of assistance by one party to another.

section.name: s4
section.content: The allocation between the parties of responsibility for particular matters or classes of matters.

section.name: s5
section.content: Arrangements for the supply of information relating to a competition matter by one party to another.

section.name: s6
section.content: Arrangements for the keeping of the other party informed about progress when one party is performing functions that may be performed concurrently under this Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.content: The joint authorship of educational material or guidelines on competition matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: carrier licence (傳送者牌照) means a carrier licence within the meaning of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Territorial application
section.leadIn: This Schedule applies to a merger even if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the arrangements for the creation of the merger take place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the merger takes place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any party to the arrangements for the creation of the merger, or any party involved in the merger is outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: An undertaking must not, directly or indirectly, carry out a merger that has, or is likely to have, the effect of substantially lessening competition in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of this section, a merger takes place if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 or more undertakings previously independent of each other cease to be independent of each other;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: an acquisition by one undertaking (the acquiring undertaking) of the whole or part of the assets (including goodwill) of another undertaking (the acquired undertaking) has the result set out in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The result referred to in subsection (2)(c) is that the acquiring undertaking is in a position to replace the acquired undertaking, or to substantially replace the acquired undertaking, in the business or in part of the business concerned (as the case requires) in which the acquired undertaking was engaged immediately before the acquisition.
The creation of a joint venture to perform, on a lasting basis, all the functions of an autonomous economic entity also constitutes a merger within the meaning of subsection (2)(b).
The prohibition imposed by subsection (1) is referred to in this Ordinance as the merger rule.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application of merger rule
section.leadIn: The merger rule applies only in the following cases—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case referred to in section 3(2)(a) of this Schedule, one or more of the undertakings participating in the merger holds a carrier licence or, directly or indirectly, controls an undertaking that holds a carrier licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case referred to in section 3(2)(b) of this Schedule, the undertaking or the person or persons acquiring control or the undertaking in which control is acquired holds a carrier licence or, directly or indirectly, controls an undertaking that holds a carrier licence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case referred to in section 3(2)(c) of this Schedule—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the acquiring undertaking or the acquired undertaking holds a carrier licence or, directly or indirectly, controls an undertaking that holds a carrier licence; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the relevant business conducted by the acquired undertaking immediately before the acquisition was conducted under a carrier licence.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, control, in relation to an undertaking, is to be regarded as existing if, by reason of rights, contracts or any other means, or any combination of rights, contracts or other means, decisive influence is capable of being exercised with regard to the activities of the undertaking and, in particular, by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ownership of, or the right to use all or part of, the assets of an undertaking; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rights or contracts which enable decisive influence to be exercised with regard to the composition, voting or decisions of any governing body of an undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, control is acquired by any person or other undertaking if the person or undertaking—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes a holder of the rights or contracts, or entitled to use the other means, referred to in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: although not becoming such a holder or entitled to use those other means, acquires the power to exercise the rights derived from them.

subsection.content: In determining whether influence of the kind referred to in subsection (1) is capable of being exercised, regard must be had to all the circumstances of the matter and not solely to the legal effect of any instrument, deed, transfer, assignment or other act done or made.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Matters that may be considered in determining whether competition substantially lessened
section.leadIn: Without limiting the matters that may be taken into account in determining whether a merger has, or is likely to have, the effect of substantially lessening competition in Hong Kong, the following matters may be taken into consideration in any such determination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the extent of competition from competitors outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the acquired undertaking, or part of the acquired undertaking, has failed or is likely to fail in the near future;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the extent to which substitutes are available or are likely to be available in the market;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the existence and height of any barriers to entry into the market;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether the merger would result in the removal of an effective and vigorous competitor;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the degree of countervailing power in the market; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the nature and extent of change and innovation in the market.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Time limit for commencement of investigation of merger

subsection.content: Despite section 39 (Power to conduct investigations), the Commission may only commence an investigation of a merger within 30 days after the day on which the Commission first became aware, or ought to have become aware, that the merger has taken place.

The Commission is to be taken to have become aware that a merger has taken place if it has been notified, in accordance with guidelines issued under this Schedule, of that fact by one of the parties to the merger.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has made a decision under section 13 of this Schedule that a merger or proposed merger is or would be excluded from the application of the merger rule or this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has rescinded that decision,

subsection.continued: the date on which the Commission became aware that the merger has taken place is to be taken to be the date of the rescission of its decision.

subsection.content: The merger rule does not apply to a merger if the economic efficiencies that arise or may arise from the merger outweigh the adverse effects caused by any lessening of competition in Hong Kong.

In any proceedings in which it is alleged that the merger rule has been contravened by a merger, any undertaking claiming the benefit of subsection (1) has the burden of proving that the conditions of that subsection are satisfied.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Exemption of merger on public policy grounds

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by order published in the Gazette, exempt a specified merger or proposed merger from the application of the merger rule if he or she is satisfied that there are exceptional and compelling reasons of public policy for doing so.
An order under subsection (1) may be made subject to any conditions or limitations that the Chief Executive in Council considers appropriate.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Orders to be published and placed before Legislative Council

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive is to arrange for every order made under section 9 of this Schedule to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: published in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: laid on the table of the Legislative Council at the next sitting of the Council after its publication in the Gazette.

subsection.content: The Legislative Council may, by resolution passed at a sitting of the Legislative Council held not later than 28 days after the sitting at which an order is laid on the table of the Council (the relevant period), amend the order in any manner consistent with the power of the Chief Executive in Council to make the order in question.

If the relevant period would but for this section expire after the end of a session or a dissolution of the Legislative Council, but on or before the day of its second sitting in the next session, the period for amending the order is deemed to be extended and to expire on the day after that second sitting.

The Legislative Council may, before the expiry of the relevant period, by resolution extend the period for amending the order to the first sitting of the Council held not earlier than the twenty-first day after the day of that expiry.

If the relevant period is extended under subsection (3), the Legislative Council may, before the expiry of the extended period, by resolution extend that extended period to the first sitting of the Council held not earlier than the twenty-first day after the day of the second sitting in the next session referred to in that subsection.

A resolution passed by the Legislative Council in accordance with this section must be published in the Gazette not later than 14 days after the passing of the resolution or within such further period as the Chief Executive may allow in any particular case.

subsection.leadIn: An order made by the Chief Executive in Council under section 9 of this Schedule comes into operation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if on the expiry of the relevant period or that period as extended under subsection (3), (4) or (5), the Legislative Council has not passed a resolution amending the order, on the expiry of the relevant period or that period as so extended (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Legislative Council passes a resolution amending the order, at the beginning of the day on which the resolution is published in the Gazette.

subsection.content: If an order is not laid on the table of the Legislative Council in accordance with this section, it is of no effect.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: sitting (會議), when used to calculate time, means the day on which the sitting commences and only includes a sitting at which subsidiary legislation is included on the order paper.

subsection.leadIn: If an undertaking—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has carried out a merger; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is carrying out, or is proposing to carry out a merger,

subsection.continued: it may apply to the Commission for a decision under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The decision referred to in subsection (1) is a decision as to whether or not the merger is, or the proposed merger would if completed be—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: excluded from the application of this Schedule by virtue of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 3 (Application to statutory bodies); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: section 4 (Application to specified persons and persons engaged in specified activities).

subsection.leadIn: The Commission is only required to consider an application under this section if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the application raises a question of an exclusion under this Ordinance for which there is no clarification in existing case law or decisions of the Commission; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is possible to make a decision on the basis of the information provided.

subsection.content: The Commission is not required to consider an application for a decision if the application concerns hypothetical questions or conduct.

subsection.leadIn: Before making a decision on an application made under section 11 of this Schedule, the Commission must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in order to bring the application to the attention of those the Commission considers likely to be affected by the decision, publish notice of the application—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider any representations about the application that are made to the Commission.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) must specify the period within which representations may be made to the Commission about the application.
The period specified for the purpose of subsection (2) must be a period of at least 30 days beginning after the day on which the notice is first published.

After considering the representations, if any, made within the period referred to in section 12 of this Schedule, the Commission may make a decision as to whether or not the merger is, or the proposed merger would if completed be, excluded from the application of the merger rule or this Schedule.

A decision by the Commission may include conditions or limitations subject to which it is to have effect including, in the case of a proposed merger, specifying a date by which the proposed merger must be completed.
After the Commission has made its decision, it must inform the applicant in writing of the decision, the date of the decision and the reasons for it.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Effect of decision
section.leadIn: If the Commission makes a decision that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a merger is excluded from the application of the merger rule or this Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a proposed merger would if completed be excluded from the application of the merger rule or this Schedule,

section.continued: then the Commission may not take any action under this Ordinance with respect to the merger or proposed merger unless it rescinds its decision under section 15 of this Schedule or the merger as implemented is materially different from the proposed merger to which the decision relates.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may rescind a decision made under section 13 of this Schedule if it has reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: whether or not the merger has been carried into effect—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the information provided by a person involved in the merger, on which it based its decision was incomplete, false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that an undertaking has failed to observe any condition or limitation subject to which the decision has effect.

subsection.leadIn: Before rescinding a decision under this section, the Commission must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in order to bring the proposed rescission to the attention of those persons the Commission considers likely to be affected by it, publish notice of the proposed rescission—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: inviting the persons to make representations about the proposed rescission within the period specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider any representations received within the period specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The notice referred to in subsection (2) must be published—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The period specified in a notice under subsection (2) must be a period of at least 30 days beginning after the day on which the notice is given.

subsection.leadIn: If, after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of the period specified in the notice given under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: considering any representations received within that period,

subsection.continued: the Commission is of the view that the decision should be rescinded, it may, by notice in writing given to each undertaking specified in the decision, rescind that decision.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of rescission given under subsection (5) must inform the undertakings of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the rescission and the reasons for the rescission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the determination to rescind the decision was made; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date from which the rescission takes effect.

subsection.content: If a decision is rescinded under this section, each undertaking specified in the notice of rescission loses its immunity from action under this Ordinance, as from the date the rescission takes effect, with regard to anything done after that date.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission must establish and maintain a register of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all decisions made in respect of applications made under section 11 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all notices of rescissions of such decisions, made under section 15 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: The Commission may omit confidential information from any entry made in the register under this section; and where confidential information has been omitted, that fact must be disclosed on the register.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission must make the register available for inspection by any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the offices of the Commission during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission must issue guidelines indicating the manner in which it expects to interpret and give effect to the provisions of this Schedule including, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the manner in which it will determine whether or not a merger would fall within the exclusion referred to in section 8(1) of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the manner and form in which it should be notified of any merger.

subsection.content: The Commission may amend any guidelines it issues under this section.
Guidelines issued under this section, and any amendments made to them, may be published in any manner the Commission considers appropriate.
Before issuing any guidelines or amendments to them under this section, the Commission must consult the Legislative Council and any persons it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission must make available copies of all guidelines issued under this section and of all amendments made to them—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the offices of the Commission during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate.

subsection.content: A person does not incur any civil or criminal liability only because the person has contravened any guidelines issued under this section or any amendments made to them.

subsection.leadIn: If, in any legal proceedings, the Tribunal or any other court is satisfied that a guideline is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guideline is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that a person contravened or did not contravene the guideline may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate the matter.

subsection.content: Guidelines issued under this section and all amendments made to them are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which Part 11 comes into operation;

pre-amended Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (原有《廣播(雜項條文)條例》) means the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391) in force immediately before the commencement date;
pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance (原有《廣播條例》) means the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) in force immediately before the commencement date;
pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance (原有《電訊條例》) means the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s2
section.heading: General provisions
section.content: Subject to sections 3 and 4 of this Schedule, anything that was done under the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance, the pre-amended Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance or the pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance and was in effect immediately before the commencement date is, in so far as it may be done under this Ordinance, to continue to have effect as if it were done under this Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Appeal Board (上訴委員會) has the meaning given by section 32L of the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance;
appeal subject matter (標的事項) has the meaning given by section 32L of the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance;
licensee (持牌人) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Any conduct in relation to a licensee that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has taken place, or has in part taken place, before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of this Ordinance, would be regulated by section 7K, 7L, 7N or 7P of the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance,

subsection.continued: may be investigated under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of that Ordinance apply in relation to that investigation, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: Any investigation initiated under the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance, before the commencement date, of any conduct in relation to a licensee that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has taken place, or has in part taken place, before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of this Ordinance, would be regulated by section 7K, 7L, 7N or 7P of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: may be continued under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of that Ordinance continue to apply in relation to that investigation, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of this Ordinance, a person may make an appeal to the Appeal Board under section 32N of the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal subject matter relates to section 7K, 7L, 7N or 7P(14) of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the appeal may be made to and disposed of by the Appeal Board under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of that Ordinance apply in relation to that appeal, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appeal made to the Appeal Board under section 32N of the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance has not been finally determined before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal subject matter relates to section 7K, 7L, 7N or 7P(14) of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the appeal may be continued and disposed of by the Appeal Board under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of that Ordinance continue to apply in relation to that appeal, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of this Ordinance, a person may bring an action under the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the action relates to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a breach of section 7K, 7L or 7N of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a breach of a licence condition, determination or direction relating to section 7K, 7L or 7N of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the action may be brought under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an action brought under the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance has not been finally determined before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the action relates to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a breach of section 7K, 7L or 7N of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a breach of a licence condition, determination or direction relating to section 7K, 7L or 7N of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the action may be continued under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may not take any action under this Ordinance in respect of a proposed change referred to in section 7P(6) of the pre-amended Telecommunications Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Communications Authority has given consent to the proposed change under section 7P(7)(a) or (b)(ii) or (iii) of that Ordinance, and the proposed change has not taken effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the proposed change takes effect on or after the commencement date—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: pursuant to the consent given, and in compliance with the direction issued, by the Communications Authority under section 7P(7)(b)(ii) of that Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to pre-amended Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance and pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the pre-amended Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Any conduct in relation to a licensee that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has taken place, or has in part taken place, before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of this Ordinance, would be regulated by section 13 or 14 of the pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance,

subsection.continued: may be investigated under the pre-amended Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of that pre-amended Ordinance apply in relation to that investigation, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: Any investigation initiated under the pre-amended Ordinance, before the commencement date, of any conduct in relation to a licensee that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has taken place, or has in part taken place, before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of this Ordinance, would be regulated by section 13 or 14 of the pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance,

subsection.continued: may be continued under the pre-amended Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of that pre-amended Ordinance continue to apply in relation to that investigation, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of this Ordinance, a licensee may make an appeal to the Chief Executive in Council under section 34 of the pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal relates to section 13 or 14 of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the appeal may be made to and disposed of by the Chief Executive in Council under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of that Ordinance apply in relation to that appeal, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appeal made to the Chief Executive in Council under section 34 of the pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance has not been finally determined before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal relates to section 13 or 14 of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the appeal may be continued and disposed of by the Chief Executive in Council under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of that Ordinance continue to apply in relation to that appeal, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of this Ordinance, a person may bring an action under the pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the action relates to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a breach of section 13 or 14 of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a breach of a licence condition, determination or direction relating to section 13 or 14 of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the action may be brought under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an action brought under the pre-amended Broadcasting Ordinance has not been finally determined before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the action relates to—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: a breach of a licence condition, determination or direction relating to section 13 or 14 of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the action may be continued under that Ordinance on or after the commencement date, as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.
